message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to start with an initial offer of $1200000 for the product.

I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget. Can you consider a price closer to $900000?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that you're looking to stay within your budget, but I'm not willing to go as low as $900000. I can meet you halfway at $1050000, which is a significant concession from my initial offer. I believe this price is still a fair reflection of the product's value.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice. However, I'm still a bit above my target price. I'm willing to compromise further and meet you at $950000. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still not willing to go as low as $950000. I'm willing to make another concession and meet you at $1050000 was a good start, but I can do $1025000. I believe this is the lowest price I can accept for the product, and I'm hoping we can finalize the deal.

I understand that you're trying to find a mutually beneficial agreement, Alice. However, I'm still a bit above my target price. I'm willing to make a small compromise and meet you at $1000000. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $1000000. I've already made significant concessions, and I believe the product's value justifies a higher price. I'm willing to meet you at $1075000, which is the lowest price I'm willing to consider. I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're trying to get a fair price for the product, Alice. However, I'm still not comfortable with the price you're asking. I'm willing to make one more compromise and meet you at $1025000. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $1025000. I've already made significant concessions, and I believe the product's value justifies a higher price. I'm willing to meet you at $1075000 was my previous offer, but I can do one better. I'll meet you at $1075000, and I'll throw in some additional services to sweeten the deal. I hope this is a price you can accept.

I appreciate your willingness to throw in some additional services, Alice. However, I'm still not comfortable with the price you're asking. I've decided to take a closer look at other options and I'm going to have to pass on this deal. I think I'll go with John's offer of $1000000 for the product.
